summary: This is an email chain from August 11, 2019, between U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and other SDNY staff discussing how to respond to a question from Senator Ben Sasse regarding the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein following his arrest and death. The correspondence shows internal deliberation about adhering to DOJ guidance on public statements.

events.title: Senator Sasse's Letter to AG Barr
events.description: Senator Ben Sasse sends a letter to Attorney General William Barr regarding Jeffrey Epstein's suicide, containing specific questions (including Question 4) that prompt this internal DOJ email discussion.

events.title: Internal SDNY Email Discussion on Senate Response
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and SDNY staff exchange emails on a Sunday to draft a conservative response to Senator Sasse's question, adhering to DOJ Office of Legal Affairs (OLA) guidance.

keyFacts: The email chain reveals internal DOJ/SDNY deliberation on how to publicly respond to congressional inquiries about the Epstein investigation, specifically following his death.
The guidance from the DOJ's Office of Legal Affairs (OLA) is cited as being conservative: either not to respond or to parrot back the question and public record.
A draft response is formulated, stating the SDNY's investigation into Epstein's conduct (including a conspiracy count) remains ongoing.
The correspondence is dated August 11, 2019, shortly after Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, indicating immediate political and legal fallout.
Multiple email addresses are redacted, indicating other SDNY/USAO staff were involved in the discussion but are not publicly named.
